sentences_tone.text: Dai Young tells Wasps backline to raise work rate against LeinsterWasps' star-studded backline have been urged to show more "belly for the fight" if they intend to transform the club from great entertainers into title winners.

No team in England has scored more tries than the Premiership leaders but the head coach Dai Young has warned his squad that scintillating attack alone will not earn a European semi-final at Leinster's expense on Saturday.

The range of crowd-pleasing talent at Wasps' disposal behind the scrum is almost reminiscent of the Harlem Globetrotters with Kurtley Beale Willie le Roux Christian Wade and Danny Cipriani capable of electrifying a game at any moment.
Young though has no desire to be seen as the Kevin Keegan of rugby union coaching applauded for the spectacular way his side attack but without any trophies to show for it.
